required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 6-Month Extension Study To The B2061032 Study To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability, And Efficacy Of DVS SR In The Treatment Of Child And Adolescent Outpatients With MDD
clinical_study.official_title: A 6-month, Open-label, Multi-center, Flexible Dose Extension Study To The B2061032 Study To Evaluate The Safety, Tolerability And Efficacy Of Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained Release (Dvs Sr) Tablets In The Treatment Of Children And Adolescent Outpatients With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: This is a 6-month, open-label, flexible-dose study evaluating Desvenlafaxine Succinate Sustained-Release (DVS SR) in the Treatment of Child and Adolescent Outpatients with Major Depressive Disorder (MDD).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
primary_outcome.description: A TEAE was defined as an event that was absent before treatment and emerged or worsened during the treatment period.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) (Combination Group)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
primary_outcome.description: A TEAE was defined as an event that was absent before treatment and emerged or worsened during the treatment period.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 26 in Total Score on the Children's Depression Rating Scale, Revised (CDRS-R), Based on Observed Cases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The CDRS-R consists of 17 items. The total score is the sum of responses to the 17 items and ranges from 17 to 113. Lower total scores indicate lower intensity of symptoms. Remission on the CDRS-R was defined as a CDRS-R score <=28. It was recommended that the CDRS-R be performed prior to the Clinical Global Impression assessments. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 26 in Total Score on the Children's Depression Rating Scale, Revised (CDRS-R), Based on Observed Cases (Combination Group)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The CDRS-R consists of 17 items. The total score is the sum of responses to the 17 items and ranges from 17 to 113. Lower total scores indicate lower intensity of symptoms. Remission on the CDRS-R was defined as a CDRS-R score <=28. It was recommended that the CDRS-R be performed prior to the Clinical Global Impression assessments. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Score From Baseline to Week 26 on the Clinical Global Impression-Severity (CGI-S) Scale, Based on Observed Cases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. The scale consists of 2 measures: the CGI-S, which rates the severity of illness from 1 to 7, and the CGI-Improvement Scale, which assesses improvement in illness since baseline. The CGI-S is a 7-point scale a clinician uses to rate a patient's severity of illness. Scores range from 1 to 7, with 1 indicating "normal, not at all ill" and 7, "among the most extremely ill patients." Higher score on the CGI-S indicates greater severity of illness. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Score From Baseline to Week 26 on the Clinical Global Impression-Severity (CGI-S) Scale, Based on Observed Cases (Combination Group)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. The scale consists of 2 measures: the CGI-S, which rates the severity of illness from 1 to 7, and the CGI-Improvement Scale, which assesses improvement in illness since baseline. The CGI-S is a 7-point scale a clinician uses to rate a patient's severity of illness. Scores range from 1 to 7, with 1 indicating "normal, not at all ill" and 7, "among the most extremely ill patients." Higher score on the CGI-S indicates greater severity of illness. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Response of Very Much Improved or Much Improved on the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Scale at Week 26, Based on Observed Cases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. The scale consists of 2 measures: the CGI-Severity scale, which rates the severity of illness from 1 to 7, and the CGI-I scale, which assesses improvement in illness since baseline. The CGI-I is a 7-point scale a clinician uses to assess improvement in a patient's illness relative to baseline. Scores range from 1 to 7, with 1 representing "very much improved" and 7 representing "very much worse"; a value of 0 meant not assessed. Lower score indicates greater improvement. Response on the CGI-I defined as the CGI-I scores of 1 or 2. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Response of Very Much Improved or Much Improved on the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Scale at Week 26, Based on Observed Cases (Combination Group)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. The scale consists of 2 measures: the CGI-Severity scale, which rates the severity of illness from 1 to 7, and the CGI-I scale, which assesses improvement in illness since baseline. The CGI-I is a 7-point scale a clinician uses to assess improvement in a patient's illness relative to baseline. Scores range from 1 to 7, with 1 representing "very much improved" and 7 representing "very much worse"; a value of 0 meant not assessed. Lower score indicates greater improvement. Response on the CGI-I defined as the CGI-I scores of 1 or 2. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants by Score on the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Scale, Based on Observed Cases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. The scale consists of 2 measures: the CGI-Severity scale, which rates the severity of illness from 1 to 7, and the CGI-I scale, which assesses improvement in illness since baseline. The CGI-I is a 7-point scale used a clinician uses to assess improvement in a patient's illness relative to baseline. Scores range from 1 to 7, with 1 representing "very much improved" and 7 representing "very much worse"; a value of 0 meant not assessed. Lower score indicates greater improvement. Response on the CGI-I defined as the CGI-I scores of 1 or 2. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants by Score on the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Scale, Based on Observed Cases (Combination Group)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. Response on the CGI-I defined as the CGI-I scores of 1 or 2. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Remission at Week 26, Based on Score on the Children's Depression Rating Scale, Revised (CDRS-R), <=28 and on Observed Cases
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: Remission on the CDRS-R was defined as a CDRS-R score <=28. The CDRS-R consists of 17 items. The total score is the sum of responses to the 17 items and ranges from 17 to 113. Lower total s cores indicate lower intensity of symptoms.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Remission at Week 26, Based on a Score on the Children's Depression Rating Scale, Revised (CDRS-R), <=28 and on Observed Cases (Combination Group)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
secondary_outcome.description: Remission on the CDRS-R was defined as a CDRS-R score <=28. The CDRS-R consists of 17 items. The total score is the sum of responses to the 17 items and ranges from 17 to 113. Lower total s cores indicate lower intensity of symptoms.

intervention.description: Subjects will receive a flexible-dose of 20, 25, 35, or 50 mg/day as prescribed by the investigator

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Completed study B2061032 and who in the investigator's opinion, would benefit from long term treatment with DVS SR
- Willingness and ability to comply with scheduled visits, treatment plan, and procedures
Exclusion Criteria:
- Requires precaution against suicide
- Not in generally healthy medical condition
- Poor compliance with study drug or study procedures during participation in study B2061032

facility.name: The University Of Alabama At Birmingham, Office Of Psychiatric Research
Medical Research Group of Central Florida
Erie County Medical Center/State University of New York (SUNY) at Buffalo Affiliate
The Zucker Hillside Hospital, North Shore-Long Island Jewish Health System
Stony Brook University Medical Center, child and Adolescent Psychiatry
Discovery and Wellness Center for Children/University Hospitals Case Medical Center

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 304 participants completed study B2061032, 283 of whom were enrolled in the current extension study, B2061030, and 281 received treatment.

group.title: Placebo/DVS-SR
group.description: Participants received placebo tablets in previous study B2061032 and desvenlafaxine succinate sustained-release (DVS-SR) in flexible dosing ranging from 20 to 50 mg in extension study B2061030.

group.title: DVS-SR, Low Dose/DVS-SR
group.description: Participants received DVS-SR in weight-based dosing (20, 25, or 35 mg) in previous study B2061032, and DVS-SR in flexible dosing ranging from 20 to 50 mg in extension study B2061030.

group.title: DVS-SR, High Dose/DVS-SR
group.description: Participants received DVS-SR in weight-based dosing (25, 35, or 50 mg) in previous study B2061032, and DVS-SR in flexible dosing ranging from 20 to 50 mg in extension study B2061030.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: Started but did not receive treatment

baseline.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug

outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in study B2061030

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE)
measure.description: A TEAE was defined as an event that was absent before treatment and emerged or worsened during the treatment period.
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in study B2061030

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) (Combination Group)
outcome.description: A TEAE was defined as an event that was absent before treatment and emerged or worsened during the treatment period.
outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
outcome.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in study B2061030

group.title: Combination Group
group.description: Combination of 3 groups of participants from previous study B2061032 received desvenlafaxine succinate sustained release in flexible dosing ranging from 20 to 50 mg in the current extension study, B2061030.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) (Combination Group)
measure.description: A TEAE was defined as an event that was absent before treatment and emerged or worsened during the treatment period.
measure.population: All participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug in study B2061030

outcome.title: Change From Baseline to Week 26 in Total Score on the Children's Depression Rating Scale, Revised (CDRS-R), Based on Observed Cases
outcome.description: The CDRS-R consists of 17 items. The total score is the sum of responses to the 17 items and ranges from 17 to 113. Lower total scores indicate lower intensity of symptoms. Remission on the CDRS-R was defined as a CDRS-R score <=28. It was recommended that the CDRS-R be performed prior to the Clinical Global Impression assessments. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.
outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
outcome.population: All participants who had a CDRS-R evaluation at Baseline of study B2061030 (Week 8 of study B2061032), took at least 1 dose of study drug, and had at least 1 CDRS-R evaluation after the first dose of study drug in B2061030.

group.title: Placebo/DVS-SR

outcome.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. The scale consists of 2 measures: the CGI-S, which rates the severity of illness from 1 to 7, and the CGI-Improvement Scale, which assesses improvement in illness since baseline. The CGI-S is a 7-point scale a clinician uses to rate a patient's severity of illness. Scores range from 1 to 7, with 1 indicating normal, not at all ill and 7, among the most extremely ill patients. Higher score on the CGI-S indicates greater severity of illness. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

Response on the CGI-I defined as the CGI-I scores of 1 or 2. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.

outcome.population: All participants who had a Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R) evaluation at Baseline of study B2061030 (Week 8 of study B2061032), took at least 1 dose of study drug, had at least 1 CDRS-R evaluation after the first dose of study drug in B2061030, and were available for evaluation.

group.title: Combination Group
group.description: Combination of 3 groups of participants from previous study B2061032 received desvenlafaxine succinate sustained release in flexible dosing ranging from 20 to 50 mg in the current extension study, B2061030.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With a Response of Very Much Improved or Much Improved on the Clinical Global Impression-Improvement (CGI-I) Scale at Week 26, Based on Observed Cases (Combination Group)
measure.description: The Clinical Global Impression (CGI) Scale is a tool that summarizes all available patient data, including history, symptoms, behavior, and the impact of the symptoms on ability to function. The scale consists of 2 measures: the CGI-Severity scale, which rates the severity of illness from 1 to 7, and the CGI-I scale, which assesses improvement in illness since baseline. The CGI-I is a 7-point scale a clinician uses to assess improvement in a patient's illness relative to baseline. Scores range from 1 to 7, with 1 representing very much improved and 7 representing very much worse; a value of 0 meant not assessed. Lower score indicates greater improvement. Response on the CGI-I defined as the CGI-I scores of 1 or 2. Mean change from baseline=score at Week 26 minus score at baseline of study B2061032.
measure.population: All participants who had a Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R) evaluation at Baseline of study B2061030 (Week 8 of study B2061032), took at least 1 dose of study drug, had at least 1 CDRS-R evaluation after the first dose of study drug in B2061030, and were available for evaluation.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Remission at Week 26, Based on Score on the Children's Depression Rating Scale, Revised (CDRS-R), <=28 and on Observed Cases
outcome.description: Remission on the CDRS-R was defined as a CDRS-R score <=28. The CDRS-R consists of 17 items. The total score is the sum of responses to the 17 items and ranges from 17 to 113. Lower total s cores indicate lower intensity of symptoms.
outcome.time_frame: From Week 8 (B2061032)/Day 1 (B2061030) to Week 26 of B2061030
outcome.population: All participants who had a CDRS-R evaluation at Baseline of study B2061030 (Week 8 of study B2061032), took at least 1 dose of study drug, and had at least 1 CDRS-R evaluation after the first dose of study drug in B2061030.

reported_events.time_frame: From informed consent through Week 30 (adverse events) and Week 32 visit (serious adverse events). For participants who discontinued prior to Week 28 visit: Adverse events collected for 14 days, and serious adverse events for 28 days,

group.title: Placebo/DVS-SR
group.description: Participants received placebo tablets in previous study B2061032 and desvenlafaxine succinate sustained-release (DVS-SR) in flexible dosing ranging from 20 to 50 mg in extension study B2061030.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
